Subject: Self-Publishing 2016
Description: This panel discusses today's self-publishing options and business models. Our panelists include authors who are both self- and traditionally published, in fiction and nonfiction, including people who are making an income entirely by self-publishing. We'll discuss why we made the choice to self-publish, the pitfalls and lessons learned, and which business choices we've made on our respective self-publishing efforts.  Speakers include:Michael Lucas, Jen Haeger, Christopher Purrett, Alex Kourvo, Robert Kroese - Track: Literature  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: SF/F Madlibs
Description: Enjoy science fiction, fantasy, and pop culture Mad-libs created by our panelists. Offer up some interesting nouns, adj, verbs and adverbs and be prepared to laugh your head off!  Speakers include:Andrea Johnson, Ferrett Steinmetz, Jackie Morgan, Jen Haeger, Alex Kourvo - Track: Literature  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: Writing Fast and Slow
Description: Are you a hack if you write quickly? Are you an amateur if you write slowly? How many books a year should a working writer produce, and how has that expectation changed in today’s publishing climate? How quickly do readers want—or expect—the next book?  Speakers include:Alex Kourvo, Jen Haeger, Jim Leach, Catheryn Valente - Track: Literature  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none
